edu.usca.acsc492l.flightplanner
Class Dijkstra

java.lang.Object
  edu.usca.acsc492l.flightplanner.Dijkstra

public class Dijkstra
extends java.lang.Object

Dijkstra's Shortest Path Algorithm for finding the shortest weighted path between two vertices (taken from Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications, 6th Edition, by Kenneth H. Rosen):

procedure Dijkstra(G: weighted connected simple graph, with all weights positive)
{G has vertices a = v0, v1, …, vn = z and weights w(vi, vj), where w(vi, vj) = ∞ if {vi, vj} is not an edge in G}
for i := 1 to n
        L(vi) := ∞
L(a) := 0
S := ∅
{the weights are now initialized so that the weight of a is 0 and all other weights are ∞, and S is the empty set}
while z ∉ S
begin
        u := a vertex not in S with L(u) minimal
        S := S ∪ {u}
        for all vertices v not in S
                 if L(u) + w(u, v) < L(v) then L(v) := L(u) + w(u, v)
        {this adds a vertex to S with minimal weight and updates the weights of vertices not in S}
end {L(z) = length of a shortest path from a to z}

computePaths

                  throws VertexException
Computes the shortest paths from the origin vertex to each destination vertex using Dijkstra's Shortest Path algorithm

Parameters:
a - the origin Vertex from which the shortest paths are calculated
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - When a is null
VertexException

                                     Airplane.AirplaneType type)
Dynamically creates and determines the reasons for visiting a Destination

Parameters:
vertex - The Vertex being visited
type - The Airplane.AirplaneType of the Airplane being used
Returns:
The Destination created using vertex and type

getShortestPath

public java.util.ArrayList<Destination> getShortestPath(Vertex z,
                                                        Airplane airplane,
                                                        long timestamp)
                                                 throws DijkstraException
Returns the shortest path from the source vertex to the target vertex

Parameters:
z - The target vertex to which the source vertex is attempting to establish a path.
airplane - The Airplane being used to traverse this path
timestamp - The time at which this method was invoked; in the event it differs from the timestamp attribute of this Dijkstra object, the local attributes of this Dijkstra object will be reset to accomodate for the new path
Returns:
the shortest path of vertices from the source vertex to the target vertex.
Throws:
DijkstraException - When the distance flown is greater than the possible range of the selected Airplane
java.lang.NullPointerException - When any of the parameters is null
